sub_steps: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Wash the bell peppers, cut the tops off, and remove the seeds and membranes.
Chop the onions and tomatoes, and mince the garlic.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and minced garlic, sauté until onions are translucent.
Mix in chopped tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, salt, and pepper.
Combine the egg mixture with sautéed vegetables and half the grated cheese.
Fill each bell pepper with the mixture and top with the remaining cheese.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes until the peppers are tender and the cheese is golden brown.
Wash the cucumbers and slice them thinly.
Place cucumber slices in a colander, sprinkle with salt, and let sit for about 30 minutes to draw out water.
Pat cucumbers dry with a paper towel.
In a large bowl, mix together white vinegar, sugar, chopped dill, and black pepper.
Add the drained cucumbers and thinly sliced red onion to the bowl.
Toss all ingredients well to ensure even coating.
Refrigerate the salad for at least one hour to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled as a refreshing side dish.
Wash and chop the bell peppers and tomatoes.
Peel and chop the onion, mince the garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large, oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, cook until onion is translucent.
Add the chopped bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Mix in the chopped tomatoes and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. Stir gently to combine.
Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Cook over low heat until the eggs are set and the bottom is golden, about 8-10 minutes.
Broil in the oven for 2-3 minutes to brown the top.
Garnish with fresh lettuce.
Cut into wedges and serve hot.
